name: .SDM File Extension
summary: Learn about .SDM files and view a list of programs that open them.

description: An SDM file is an email message created by Sun Microsystems StarOffice Mail, an email client included with early versions of the StarOffice office suite. It stores the complete contents of an email message, including the text, sender and recipient information, subject line, and any attachments.

content: StarOffice Mail was part of the broader StarOffice suite, which included tools for word processing, spreadsheets, presentations, and more. The mail client allowed users to send, receive, and organize email directly within the suite. When users composed or received messages, the email client saved emails as SDM files.

Each SDM file contains a complete record of a single email, including metadata such as sender, recipient, date, and subject. Any file attachments were embedded within the same file, making SDM files helpful in archiving or sharing individual messages.

StarOffice Mail and the SDM format became obsolete after Sun Microsystems acquired StarDivision in 1999 and transitioned the suite to OpenOffice.org. Sun Microsystems discontinued the mail client during this transition, and support for SDM files ceased. As a result, SDM files are now rare.

instructions: You can open SDM files with Sun Microsystems StarOffice Mail. However, the software is discontinued.
